goal.core.program.actions

Class InsertAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.actions.Action
        • goal.core.program.actions.MentalAction
          • goal.core.program.actions.InsertAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class InsertAction
extends MentalAction
    Inserts an Update into the agent's BeliefBase and/or mail box. As these are two different databases that the agent maintains, two updates are associated with the insert action. One update for the agent's belief base and one for the agent's mail box.

    If the action is closed, the insert action can be performed.

    Percepts of the form percept(...) cannot be inserted into the percept base by an insert action. Percepts are automatically retrieved from the environment and inserted into the agent's percept base every start of a reasoning cycle.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • InsertAction

        public InsertAction(Selector selector,
            Update beliefUpdate,
            Update mailboxUpdate,
            InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates an InsertAction that inserts an Update into the BeliefBase and/or mail box of an agent.
        Parameters:
        selector - The Selector of this action.
        beliefUpdate - The Update to be inserted into to the BeliefBase.
        mailboxUpdate - The Update to be removed from the mail box.
        source - The source code location of this action, if available; null otherwise.

      • applySubst

        public InsertAction applySubst(Substitution substitution)

        Specified by:
        applySubst in class Action
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getPrecondition

        public MentalStateCond getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
                                throws GOALParseException
        The precondition of an InsertAction is true, or, to be more precise "bel(true)"; this means it can always be performed if the action is closed.
        Specified by:
        getPrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        language - The KR language used for representing the precondition.
        Returns:
        The MentalStateCond "bel(true)".
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - In case the KR parser had a problem parsing "true".

      • evaluatePrecondition

        public InsertAction evaluatePrecondition(MentalState mentalState,
                                Debugger debugger,
                                boolean last)
        Checks whether the precondition of InsertAction holds. See also: getPrecondition(KRlanguage).
        Specified by:
        evaluatePrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the precondition is evaluated.
        debugger - The current debugger
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        This action since insert has "empty" precondition.

      • executeAction

        protected Result executeAction(RunState<?> runState,
                   Debugger debugger)
        Executes the Action.
        Executes the InsertAction by applying the Updates to the BeliefBase and/or mail box. Also may update the GoalBase if a goal holds after the update; those goals are removed.
        Specified by:
        executeAction in class Action
        Parameters:
        runState - The RunState in which the action is executed.
        debugger - The current debugger.
        Returns:
        The action that has been executed; never returns null but throws runtime exceptions if executing the action fails.
